intro: Oreogrammitis jagoriana, commonly known as the jagoriana wall-rush, is a species of moss belonging to the family Hypnaceae. It is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, closely spaced leaves that are often curved and have a distinct costa. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rocky crevices or forest floors. Its spore capsules are urn-shaped and often borne on short, lateral branches. Oreogrammitis jagoriana is a relatively rare species, found primarily in specific geographic regions with suitable microhabitats.
